column14: abuse and diversion also commonly known as Opioid abuse
column16: Controlled substances are a broad classification of medications that are considered "habit forming" by the DEA. Controlled substances include stimulants, benzodiazepines and opioids (to name a few). Recommend leaving off the term "opioid abuse" since it doesn not accurately reflect the spectrum of substance use disorders than can be caused by habit forming substances
column17: Remove specific call-out of Opioid abuse

column14: history before prescribing any controlled substances

column16: Patient Identifier--only option is SSN. Not sure if this is always collected by pharmacies

column25: SSN is the data element provided by the PDMP response and you are correct it may not always be present. Other identifiers would be allowed in the FHIR Patient.identifier.

column14:
EVN will be used to record a medication statement where the patient is currently taking or has taken the medication in the past. INT will be used to record a medication statement where the patient plans to take the medication or be
administered the medication in the future.
column16: Both options can be simultaeously true. A substance can be taken in the past, not currently be consumed, but restarted in the future.
column17: Both options can be simultaeously true. A substance can be taken in the past, not currently be consumed, but restarted in the future.

column16: The required elements for identification of this patient profile search are name, birthdate and the required period of the search. In a highly populated state this may result in several hits or incorrect hits.
